name: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid
Reason: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid has a melting point of 140.0 degrees Celsius. The presence of a hydroxyl group increases the melting point due to the formation of intermolecular hydrogen bonds. The methoxy group also increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The carboxylic acid group can form intermolecular hydrogen bonds and increase the melting point. The presence of a hydroxyl group and a methoxy group can slightly lower the melting point due to the reduced symmetry and increased rotational freedom. However, the presence of a carboxylic acid group can increase the melting point due to the formation of intermolecular hydrogen bonds.
